Wind Waker Ocarina of Time Links Awakening DX

Ocarina of Time

Links first 3D adventure - The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of time.

Hyrule

Explore the fantasy lands of Hyrule as Link to stop the evil ganondorf, king of the gerubo tribe, from obtaining the Triforce.

Travel through time and navigate dungeons to find the seven sages who can seal ganondorf forever.

Variety of items

Explore the temples and dungeons to find a huge variety of items.

Hylian shield

The master sword

the Ocarina of Time

Never Before Seen Gameplay

Control Link for the first time in a third person perspective in a three-dimensional world! Battle with your sword or other weapons such as bombs, projectiles and magic spells.

Freely control your actions with the brand new control scheme context-sensitive actions and easily latch on to enemies with the Z-targeting system.

The on-screen display shows actions mapped to context-sensitive buttons.

When the player uses Z-targeting, the view shifts to a letterbox format and arrows indicate the targeted enemy. The player can then circle strafe around the enemy to keep their sight on them

Greatest Video Game Ever Made

In Japan, more than 820,000 copies were sold in 1998, making it the year's tenth-bestselling game. During its lifetime, over a million copies were sold in Japan, with over seven million sold worldwide. The game won numerous awards and accolades and is considered by many to be one of the greatest video games ever made, with numerous publications having ranked it the best video game of all time.

The biggest game of the decade

"MASTERPIECE! The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time is a 10 out of 10." - IGN

Flawless

"Ocarina of Time definitely follows in the footsteps of the previous games, and the result is a game that can't be called anything other than flawless." - GameSpot

Only on nintendo 64
